original_title: Sri Lanka rupee opens at Rs305.50/306 to US dollar, bond yields steady
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka rupee ended at 305.50/306 to the US dollar on Monday, while bond yields were steady.
The Spot US dollar closed at 306.00/307.00 rupees on Monday after interventions around 314 to the US dollar and moral suasion, market participants said.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 22.90/23.10 percent, steady from yesterday’s close at 23.00/23.10 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2025 was quoted at 27.05/15 percent, steady from yesterday’s 27.00/10 percent.
Three-months maturing bill was quoted at 22.25/75 percent, down from Monday’s close  at 21.75/22.30 percent.
A six-month maturing bill was quoted at 19.00/20.00 percent steady from 19.00/20.25 percent from Monday’s close. (Colombo/ June 20/2023)
